ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Qualifying public sector bodies as listed in the procurement documents

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: C1911 Framework for the Provision of Electricity and Gas, in partnership with The Energy Brokers Ltd (replaces previous notice 2018/S 015-031596)

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Gas and electricity framework for the NHS Salisbury Foundation Trust supported by The Energy Broker who will administer the process.
This framework for fixed term and flexible energy contracts will be available to universities and other public sector bodies.
The contents of this document are to provide such details, as suppliers may need to take part in the process of bidding through the use of a competitive procedure with negotiation.
The framework will begin on 1 October 2018 for a 48-month period.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Lot One — Flexible Contracts for Mains Gas

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of flexible contracts for Mains Gas which is capable of delivering a flexible purchasing consortium product – (Cashout only Product).
Approximate framework volume 100GWh to 500Gwh per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of flexible contracts for Mains Gas which is capable of delivering a flexible purchasing consortium product – (Cashout only Product).
Approximate framework volume 100GWh to 500Gwh per annum.
Approximate value £4M to £20M per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Lot Two — Flexible Contracts for Half Hourly Electricity

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of flexible contracts for electricity which is capable of delivering flexible purchasing consortium product – (Baseload only, Volume Tolerance Product).
Approximate framework volume £100 GWh to 500 GWh per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of flexible contracts for electricity which is capable of delivering flexible purchasing consortium product – (Baseload only, Volume Tolerance Product).
Approximate framework volume £100 GWh to 500 GWh per annum.
Approximate value £12M to £60M per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Lot Three — Fixed Term Contracts for Non-Half Hourly Electricity

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of fixed price contract for non-half hourly electricity (fixing both wholesale energy and third party costs).
This will include & fix — CfD, FITS, RO, CM, BUSOS, Elexon & EII.
Approximate framework volume 20 GWh to 75 GWh per annum.
This will be awarded to a number of suppliers who will take part in a mini-competition to meet the specific requirements of each customer.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of fixed price contract for non-half hourly electricity (fixing both wholesale energy and third party costs).
This will include & fix — CfD, FITS, RO, CM, BUSOS, Elexon & EII.
Approximate framework volume 20 GWh to 75 GWh per annum.
Approximate value £3M to £11.25M per annum.
This will be awarded to a number of suppliers who will take part in a mini-competition to meet the specific requirements of each customer.
TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply energy in the following formats:
Lot One — Flexible Contracts for Mains Gas — which is capable of delivering a flexible purchasing consortium product – (Cashout only Product).
Approximate framework volume 100GWh to 500Gwh per annum.
Approximate value £4M to £20M per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.

Lot Two — TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of flexible contracts for electricity which is capable of delivering flexible purchasing consortium product – (Baseload only, Volume Tolerance Product).
Approximate framework volume £100 GWh to 500 GWh per annum.
Approximate value £12M to £60M per annum.
This will be awarded to a single supplier for supplying all the framework needs.
Lot Three — TEBL wishes to establish a framework agreement for the supply of fixed price contract for non-half hourly electricity (fixing both wholesale energy and third party costs).
This will include & fix — CfD, FITS, RO, CM, BUSOS, Elexon & EII.
Approximate framework volume 20 GWh to 75 GWh per annum.
Approximate value £3M to £11.25M per annum.
This will be awarded to a number of suppliers who will take part in a mini-competition to meet the specific requirements of each customer.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

LEGAL_FORM.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

The Energy Broker (TEBL) is seeking to establish a 4-year framework agreements with suppliers for the provision of electricity and gas with TEBL acting as an intermediary to buy these products on the wholesale market on behalf of University and Local Authorities organisations within England, Wales and Scotland. The details of these organisations can be viewed at the following web address: https://secure.tebl.com/tender/healthcarelist
For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Bravo eSourcing portal at: https://nhs.bravosolution.co.uk/nhs_collaborative/web/login.html

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: In accordance with Regulation 86 and 87 of the Public.

Contracts Regulations 2015, this contracting authority will incorporate a minimum of 10 calendar day standstill period starting from the day information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. The Public Contracts Regulations provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland).
